title: Venezuelan Shredded Chicken with Arepas

ingredients.content: 280 g precooked maize flour (e.g. Harina Pan)
1 ½ - 2 tsp fine sea salt, to taste
5 sprigs fresh coriander, plus extra leaves for garnish
1 red pepper (approx. 150 g), cut in pieces
1 ½ - 2 tsp fine sea salt, to taste
½ - 1 tsp ground black pepper, to taste
560 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut in bite-size pieces

preparations.content: Place maize flour, water and salt in mixing bowl then mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place coriander in mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onion, red pepper, garlic cloves, capers, tomato, salt, black pepper and olive oil in mixing bowl then chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Sauté <b>4 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.

Add chicken, sherry and reserved chopped coriander then cook <b>18 min/100°C//speed 1<b>. Meanwhile, with wet hands divide arepas dough into 8 equal pieces and form into ball shapes. Squeeze each ball between wet hands and shape into the traditional round shape (Ø 10 cm, 1 cm thick). Fill a deep frying pan with 0.5 cm olive oil, over medium heat and fry each flatbread approx. 3 minutes on each side. Drain on paper towels.
Shred chicken <b>5 sec//speed 4<b>. Serve immediately in fried arepas, garnished with coriander.
